class_notes: Students must also register for a BIOL 142L section. This course expands on the fundamentals learned in Biology 141. The topics covered in class will address major issues in research and medicine, emphasizing critical thinking involved in modern biological discovery. Prerequisites: Biology 141 and Biology 141L; Corequisite: Biology 142L.
course_description: Major topics include: molecular genetics, population genetics, genomics, evolution, gene expression regulation, signal transduction, cancer and development.
prerequisites: This course requires BIOL 141 and BIOL 141L or BIOL 151or BIOL_OX141 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 1562, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MWF 2:30-4:45p, Instructor: K. Campbell, Status: Open
